page.title: 06ECOLOGY IN NORTH TYNEDALE
page.content: This is quite a wet area with an average of 40ins. of rain per year.This{summer}has been the wettest on record with 12ins. of rain falling in June, July and August. We have twice had 2.75 ins. of rain falling in 24 hours. The winds were from the west bringing in the rain from the Atlantic.{.Autumn}comes usually in September with drier weather but this year September was wet, and October has been dry with exceptionally high temperatures. On the 1st of October it was 32F and the sun has shone on most days with a little ground frost at nights. The{winters}are wet and cold often with a barren wind from the North and East bringing in snow with hard frosts at night.{Spring}is late usually April and May and not very warm.
